Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. [clapping and chanting] I got a big box, yes I do. I got a big box how 'bout you? [points to Erin]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [clapping] I got a big box, yes I do. I got a big box how 'bout you? [points to Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think you don't know what you're saying.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's from "Sob-ray", our new owner, and it is to Sabre, us. I wonder what's inside. Scissor me. [Erin tosses Michael open scissors, Pam is appalled]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin was recently bought by an electronics company named Sabre. [mispronounced "sob-ray"] They stepped in at the 11th hour, and they saved our asses. Although David Wallace said that we were the one branch that was actually working right, so we probably could have saved our own asses. We didn't need them touching our asses.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! [rips open cardboard box] Wow. Awesome. [distributing items] For accounting, a brand new printer. And for the sales staff, a new fax machine. This cord has Creed written all over it. And whoever would like a brand new scanner can come visit it in my office. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here we go. [scans stuffed animal] Oh! Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool. What next? [Dwight puts his face on scanner]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Guys, um, who's Gabe? This note says to put the box aside for Gabe Lewis, who's coming tomorrow?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, everybody, listen up. I have some bad news. Due to circumstances beyond my control -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Impulsivity and inattention to detail.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey. I have opened a box, which should not have been opened...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Terrible mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And distributed things which should not have been distributed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Undistributable.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, maybe we can put the box back together.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Impossible. He opened it like an ape.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think we can do it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam and Oscar are trying to repack cardboard box] Yep, yep.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Right? Mm. Did we try printer first? Shredder at an angle -

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Fax, cable, then the scanner upside down?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Have you tried making everything smaller?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And - [Jim seals box with tape, rips covered with stickers] Wow. Really nice job. This group of people, when they put their minds together, they can do something great. And I think that you should all be proud of yourselves. [cell phone starts ringing from inside box]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, relax. We can do it. We just did it. So we can do this again. Erin, scissor me please. [Erin tosses open scissors across Jim and Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, don't!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [fumbles] Thank you. Oh! Got it. Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, he's on his way up. Okay. Are we ready?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you want us to do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do I have to explain everything?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because we're usually not on the same page.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [starts round of applause]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh. Okay. And to you. [begins applauding]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gabe seems tall. Hope we get along. Had a very good thing going with David Wallace. He was a good guy. He was somebody I could trust. Here he is. [holding up photo of him and Wallace] You can really see that he is ok taking a picture with me. Even though I was there for disciplinary reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Welcome. Scranton hot dog from Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, Dwight? Let's give him a minute to settle in, shall we? Ok?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Um, hi, uh, my name is Gabe Lewis. I am coordinating director for merging regions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Gabe. I am Michael Scott, co-manager. This is my protege, Jim Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Co-manager, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In training.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Trained. Loving it. Good at it. So...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: We are very impressed with this branch and we are so excited about this merger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're very excited too, aren't we guys? Right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So excited.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have a little song prepared for you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Um, actually, if you don't mind, I would love to put this on the Sabre website. [correctly pronounced "say-ber"]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sabre. Say-ber. Sabre.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, say-ber. Good. Take it away guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok. [playing guitar to the tune of Miley Cyrus' Party in the USA]

Quote.Speaker: Andy & Erin
Quote.Text: [singing] Hopped off the train in Scranton, PA, another cloudy gray afternoon. Jumped in the cab, here you are for the first time, look to the right see the "Electric City" sign. This is gonna be good day, for Dunder Mifflin and Sob-ray. Sab - [guitar stops]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Saber.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Saber. [sings] Dunder Mifflin and Saber. So yeah, yeah, yay, yay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy & Erin
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin is a part of Sob-ray. So yeah, yeah, yay, yay. Dunder Mifflin is a part of Sabre. [music stops]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You sure it's saber?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you. Hey, we should be fine if we leave around 11:20.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, you mapquested it. It's four blocks away.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, now we won't get lost. Or we could drive. And that takes one minute.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We found a great local daycare. It's rated really high by all the local parenting websites. But that means it's also really hard to get into.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Turns out, a lot of parents want the very best for their children. That's weird.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're hoping our interview seals the deal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But if not, there's always the army. The infantry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Gabe starts DVD]

Quote.Speaker: Christian Slater
Quote.Text: So you've just been bought by Sabre. You've probably got a lot of questions. Hi. I'm Christian Slater. What's it like to work for Sabre? Let's find out together. Working at Sabre means taking on the challenge of the road that rises to meet you. Sabre is respecting the past, but opening a window to the future. Have you ever tasted a rainbow? At Sabre, you will.

Quote.Speaker: Jo Bennett
Quote.Text: You'll find it easy to embrace the Sabre spirit. Welcome. We're very excited to go on this journey with you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Christian Slater impression] So you've been shown a nonsensical video. You're probably wondering, "What's going on?" Well, you're not alone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Really terrific.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Most of our business comes from selling printers. So don't think of yourselves as paper salesmen anymore, but as printer salesmen who also sell paper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Don't like that.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: At Sabre, we really encourage honest communication. You should always feel free to express your thoughts, your -

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Talk about vacation days!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: We have a policy here at Sabre where we are, uh, allowed to take two weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: But I banked six weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I already booked a Great Lakes cruise.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, who the hell's going through our stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Actually, that's Nick. He's your new IT guy. Uh, he's setting up a site blocker. Mostly blocking the inappropriate sites. And then there are the time-wasting sites like Twitter, YouTube. We are blocking those as well.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm, nope. Don't like that.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ok, did everyone get one? With these bottles, we eliminate the need for plastic water bottles, which are the scourge of the environment.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We'll still get to use the little cups, though, right?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Little cups? Like paper or plastic or... ?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know what they're made of.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They're 2 ounce paper cups dipped in plastic. He goes through 20 a day.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ok, well, I bet you can fit 20 little cups of water in your aluminum bottle.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what can't fit in a bottle, are the 20 little trips I take to the cooler, and the 20 little scans I do of everybody to make sure everything's running smoothly. And the 20 little conversations that I have with Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There is a small part of me that is actually very excited about this new company. But 70 percent of me is water, and the other part, the real part, the part that has feelings and emotions and thoughts and makes decisions and, if I can be crass, makes babies, that part thinks that all of these changes suck ba -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in line to fill up water bottle behind Kevin and Toby] Really? You don't have enough water in there? Your stomach?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Looks like we kicked it. [indicates water jug is empty]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I miss the old Dunder Mifflin. Too much change is not a good thing. Ask the climate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't want to appear ungrateful for everything Sabre's doing for us.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't get that sense at all from you, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you should have a little. But it's great that you don't, because I am trying to embrace all of these changes, but I'm - I'll be honest, I'm having trouble wrapping my head around a couple of 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Which ones?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All of them.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well, I wish that I could do something, but it's kind of policy, you know? Above my pay grade. You know?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So maybe we should call. We should call someone. I could help. I'm good with bosses. Call one of the higher-ups?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You know what? Let me see what I can do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [after entering daycare] Ok, this is officially the cutest thing I've ever seen. Cubbies. I totally forgot about cubbies.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's a finger-painting station and a curly slide. Am I too old to go here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Adorable, right? [opens kiddie bathroom, sees man on toilet] I walked in on someone in the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just walked in on someone in the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who? The -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The guy we're meeting with?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am telling you, there are no strawberries in here.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, I saw them in there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well maybe they ran away, because the pizza was like, [imitating Italian accent] "Hey, get out of here, you stupid strawberries."

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I think when Andy finally asks me out he's going to try to top what he did with the drum line. I can't wait to see what he comes up with.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The ball's totally in Erin's court. After the whole drum line thing.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [on videochat] First let me say that I told them everything you wanted me to say, in just the way you wanted me to say it, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Gabe, honey, I love this. I love the sound of your voice. But I really need some new information now.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ok, um, I told the story of your uncle, and I have a feeling that you would have [Michael gesturing behind computer] really been proud of the way... Okay, um...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Wait a minute, who is it? Who's there? Is there somebody in the room with you? [Michael gesturing "no"] I want to see who it is. Turn me around.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I don't - it's just...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Turn me around. Now. [Michael starts to leave, Jo whistles] Hey, Buddy. Is it something I said?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. No. My name's Michael Scott. Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh, hello, Mr. Scott. Pleased to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you. We are very excited about the merger with Sabre. I think you have a great accent.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Aw, thank you. I've been working on it since I was a little girl. To, um, to what do I owe the pleasure of this videochat?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I am little concerned with all of these changes, to be quite frank. I think we have done things a certain way here at Dunder Mifflin for quite some time, and -

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Pardon. Pardon me, Mr. Scott, but the last time I saw a company as mismanaged as Dunder Mifflin, it was my grandson's snowball company, so you'll excuse me if I prefer that you all adapt to the way that we do things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. I feel very strongly that you can't just come in here and change everything that people have been doing forever. Is Christian Slater back there? Because... he knows. He'd know what to do.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: So listen, why don't you tell Gabe if by the end of the day you can't handle the changes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have already told him, but I will tell him again if you think that will help.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I would take until the end of the day if I were you. [Michael leaves conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Michael throws aluminum bottle out of car window, breaks a windshield, speeds out of parking lot]

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: Pam and Jim? Hey, I'm Jerry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi Jerry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Jerry.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: Good to see you. Come on in. My office is right back here. This is the play room.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is great. Got to confess, we came a little early, so we got a quick look around, but, uh -

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: Oh, so you saw it already?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. Yes. We saw this, yes. No, it wasn't like a look around. We really just had a peek. Quick peek. Didn't focus on anything in particular.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's lovely.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: [cell phone rings] Oh. Got to take this. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: Okay. Hi, this is Jerry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, you've got to pull it together.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We should just go. He's really uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's uncomfortable because you're acting weird. So you have to stop acting weird.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What if we just bring it up? We just put it out in the open?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's the weirdest possible solution to the problem.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: Sorry about that. Right this way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have come here today to talk to Mr. David Wallace about this whole thing going on with Sabre. [rings doorbell] He will know exactly what to do. He is not a big fan of me dropping by announced. But then again, who is? [loud drumming as door opens] Hey. Hi, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hope you're not busy doing something.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No, you kidding? Come on in. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You sure?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You look great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You look great too.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You hungry? I'm just having lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, that sounds good.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Fantastic. Teddy, look who just stopped in.

Quote.Speaker: Teddy Wallace
Quote.Text: Huh? Hey. [continues drumming]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Keep it up, son.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really loud.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Oh, yummy. [David spreads marshmallow fluff on bread] You have got the life, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can I just stay here and never go back?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Things not going so well there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, man. How much time do you have?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I have a doctor's appointment next Thursday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Wallace
Quote.Text: Hey, honey. How's your day going? Did you do anything cool?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Uh, no, sweetie. I just sort of hung out.

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Wallace
Quote.Text: Oh, 'cause I saw you had shoes on, so I didn't know if you did anything.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No. Just hanging out, honey. You remember Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi. Sorry, I was just in the neighborhood, thought I'd come by, see...

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. Wallace
Quote.Text: No problem at all. This is great. So what are you guys up to?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Uh, but maybe, uh - actually, you know, I think maybe we'll go outside. May -maybe we'll go outside. [drumming intensifies] Outside.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There was one thing we were curious about, uh, your flexibility on things like Easter or Memorial Day, because we might want to change our days around a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: That seems a bit premature, don't you think? I don't even know if I have a space for you yet, and you're already lining up your holiday plans.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no, sorry. Just, um, we're kind of planners. But we're also flexible too, so you know what? Maybe we can just discuss it when the time comes.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: Yeah, if the time comes, we can discuss it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is this because Jim walked in on you going to the bathroom?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: Seriously? You told her?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did it? It might have come up while we were waiting for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: And you - you thought that might have something to do with how the meeting is going?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe, because it doesn't seem to be going super well.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: Well, you didn't consider the fact that it might not be going super well just because it might not be going super well?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope. 'Cause we're really nice people but you don't seem to like us.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: I'm being perfectly pleasant. Did you ever consider that you might not be as charming as you think you are?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, this coming from the guy who still uses a children's toilet? Why didn't you just lock the door, man?

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: It doesn't lock for the children's safety.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Anybody could have walked in.

Quote.Speaker: Jerry
Quote.Text: It was story time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sabre is changing everything. [Michael and David sitting in hot tub] Site blockers. They don't let us use cups. So I started thinking, who could handle this? Who would know what to do? David Wallace would know what to do. What should I do, David Wallace?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I don't know. I mean, what can you do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly. What are you thinking?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I, I - It's a tough one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is a tough one.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I don't have any ideas for you there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. But one would be good.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hey, oh, okay. Wait.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I want to tell you about a business idea I have.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Ok? You know how kids leave their toys everywhere? Okay. So this is a vacuum. It's like a shop-vac type of thing. [imitates vacuum] Teaches kids how to pick up their own toys. Right? Baseball gloves, hacky sacks, drumsticks. [sucking noise] Picks it up!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So the kid's making the noise to pick it up.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No. No, no, no. That's the -that's the vacuum noise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You-you don't like it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I think it is-

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No, it's ok. Another guy from Dunder Mifflin, Arnie from Research, he's gonna draw up the prototype. And, uh... It's like shop-vac. [sucking noise] Did I say that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: It'll be ok.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, any fun weekend plans?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, no, actually. So nothing? No movies, or parties, or anything you might want to invite someone to?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Nothing. It's wide open.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's as hard as I can hint.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hey, you know, if you want, I'm sure I can get Arnie on board if you wanted to join us for suck it. Work together again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The what?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Suck it. That's what it's called.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Huh? Catchy. Kids'll love it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There are very few things that would make me not want to team up with David Wallace. And Suck It is one of 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See you later. [hugs Wallace]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bye now.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Thank you for coming.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks for having me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's not the David Wallace that I remember. [reverses out of driveway, Wallace follows him] That is some sort of weird creature that lives in David Wallace's house. Oh, my god. Alright. Just get me out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. [comes in carrying 4 gallons of orange juice and his water bottle] Is anybody home? Oh, thank you, Erin. Now if everyone would please ready their canteens, so I can fill them with the sweet, sweet nectar of Gabe's homeland, and then propose a toast. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know when people say getting fired was the best thing that ever happened to them? I feel sorry for those people. That's the best thing? Really? Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'm not really one for making speeches.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes, you are. You make a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But I feel pretty good right now. I really do. A lot better than I did earlier. Let me tell you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That's your toast?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. This is my toast. I think this whole thing with Sabre is going to work out. I have a very good feeling about it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, this isn't a toast. You're just thinking out loud.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's my toast. Orange juice is in here. And, like Saber, it is from Florida, and it is good.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Just 'cause you have liquid that doesn't make it a toast.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's the toast. I'm gonna do it now. Raise your container to us and to Sabre.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: To us and to Sabre.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm. Wow. That is metallicy. Ugh. That's like drinking a battery. Ah, really gets you in the fillings, doesn't it? Okay, anyway, welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [David Wallace at keyboard, Teddy playing drums]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [singing] Well, it's a mess, what a mess. What you gonna do? You're going to take out your Suck It and you suck it. Suck it. Yeah, take out your Suck It and you suck it.

Quote.Speaker: Teddy
Quote.Text: Suck it!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah!
